message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.NE, cs.DS

This paper deals with the problem of explaining the decisions made by Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) in node classification tasks. The paper proposes new methods for explaining the informative components and important node features in the input data used by the GNN model. This work is relevant to several sub-categories of computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), social and information networks (cs.SI), neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE), and data structures and algorithms (cs.DS).
